New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2023 年 12 月 10 日星期日 10:10:34 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Art and Matilda Green welcome baby number three Penelope https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/art-and-matilda-green-welcome-baby-number- Three-penelope/UA76BZ26WVETPM43KYPES6JAZA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/art-and-matilda-green-welcome-baby-number- Three-penelope/UA76BZ26WVETPM43KYPES6JAZA/ Former Bachelor NZ contestants announced the birth on social media tonight. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 08:18:21 +0000 Matilda Green with her new baby girl Penelope.
East Coast father tried to ‘cover his tracks’ after maiming son in firearm incident https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/east-coast-father-tried-to-cover-his-tracks-after-maiming-son-in-firearm-incident/7GX4S3JELRBTFIDQPYEAMHZURE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/east-coast-father-tried-to-cover-his-tracks-after-maiming-son-in-firearm-incident/7GX4S3JELRBTFIDQPYEAMHZURE/ Waiting for a rescue chopper to arrive, the man concocted a story to hide his offending. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 08:04:29 +0000 A father's carelessness with a rifle in a remote part of the East Coast led to his son being seriously wounded. Photo / Gisborne Herald
Avonhead, Christchurch armed standoff: Homes evacuated as police negotiate with person reported to have firearm https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/armed-police-encouraging-person-to-come-out-of-residential-address-in-avonhead-christchurch/NEIPQCLVXRFEZLR4N7NFC4U5MQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/armed-police-encouraging-person-to-come-out-of-residential-address-in-avonhead-christchurch/NEIPQCLVXRFEZLR4N7NFC4U5MQ/ Benjamin PlummerPolice have blocked off the street as they respond to the ongoing incident. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 07:38:20 +0000 A police spokesperson said they are "encouraging a person to come out" of the residential address. Photo / George Heard
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade investigates reports of Kiwi death in Gaza https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ministry-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade-investigates-reports-of-kiwi-death-in-gaza/DMZPGV4P25CUVPQL6VEQ4Z7RDE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ministry-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade-investigates-reports-of-kiwi-death-in-gaza/DMZPGV4P25CUVPQL6VEQ4Z7RDE/ There have been reports a New Zealander has died. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 06:48:19 +0000 Smoke rises from the Gaza Strip after Israeli strikes. Photo / AP
Six people injured, one arrested after pedestrians hit by car in Half Moon Bay https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/four-people-injured-one-arrested-after-pedestrians-hit-by-car-in-half-moon-bay/YVNVE6W6Z5FTDO6K7XVSOSS4NA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/four-people-injured-one-arrested-after-pedestrians-hit-by-car-in-half-moon-bay/YVNVE6W6Z5FTDO6K7XVSOSS4NA/ The road is closed and enquiries into the circumstances of the incident are ongoing. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 06:38:34 +0000 Police remain in attendance of an earlier crash in Half Moon Bay which left six pedestrians with injuries. Photo / Hayden Woodward
Māngere Bridge fire: Families who lost everything supported by community https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mangere-bridge-fire-families-who-lost-everything-supported-by-community/6IORDK3OCFEHPACAGAQOKI6W4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mangere-bridge-fire-families-who-lost-everything-supported-by-community/6IORDK3OCFEHPACAGAQOKI6W4/ Two weeks ago, a fire ripped through a church complex at Māngere Bridge. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 05:12:25 +0000 The fire at the Māngere Bridge church complex destroyed transitional homes, residents' belongings and a car. Photo / RNZ / Jordan Dunn
Police respond to person ‘discharging shots’ in Hobsonville, Auckland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-respond-to-person-discharging-shots-in-auckland-suburb-of-hobsonville/UOLSIQETM5HYNBXGOHVHUVK5LA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-respond-to-person-discharging-shots-in-auckland-suburb-of-hobsonville/UOLSIQETM5HYNBXGOHVHUVK5LA/ Police have been notified of a person discharging shots at an industrial building. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 04:53:40 +0000 Police are staging on nearby Luckens Road, West Harbour. Photo / Hayden Woodward
Baby found in impounded car at Waikato street-racing eventhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/baby-found-in-imounded-car-at-waikato-street-racing-event/VZ5L3I2EBFHK3FRAFYQF53CF2E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/baby-found-in-imounded-car-at-waikato-street-racing-event/VZ5L3I2EBFHK3FRAFYQF53CF2E/ Police found baby in a car at street racer event where over 200 infringements were given. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 04:38:19 +0000 More than 1000 drivers blocked roads and exhibited unsafe driving behaviours across Waikato overnight, police said. Photo / 123RF
News media’s online dependence: From paper to platform https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news-medias-online-dependence-from-paper-to-platform/VFS6QVE32FHJXFD4GBQSGBSIL4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news-medias-online-dependence-from-paper-to-platform/VFS6QVE32FHJXFD4GBQSGBSIL4/ Colin PeacockDr Merja Myllylahti has studied the impact of social media on our news. Operation Shadow: Police make multiple arrests, issue hundreds of infringement notices after illegal street racing in Waikato https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/operation-shadow-police-make-multiple-arrests-issue-hundreds-of-infringement-notices-after-illegal-street-racing-in-waikato/MFMVX7E45BGRVD4IGQ4DEILV3A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/operation-shadow-police-make-multiple-arrests-issue-hundreds-of-infringement-notices-after-illegal-street-racing-in-waikato/MFMVX7E45BGRVD4IGQ4DEILV3A/ Benjamin PlummerTwo people were also stabbed shortly after midnight in the Matamata area. Sun, 10 Dec 2023 04:12:04 +0000 Police issued around 220 traffic infringements and a number of others to bystanders. Photo / NZME
